metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: One bad apple can spoil a barrel

cognitieve_implicaties: Moral failure is contagious and irreversible

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: A common cliché used as a 'ground clearing' device.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: He made the libel his label

cognitieve_implicaties: God intentionally adopts the shame of the human condition
theologische_implicaties: The Cross is the ultimate subversion of worldly judgment
ethische_implicaties: Believers should not fear social stigma when following Christ

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Wordplay (libel/label) re-activates the concept of social identity.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher starts with a 'separationist' schema (bad apples, flee the plague) to establish moral norms, then intentionally disrupts it with the 'incarnational' schema of Jesus as the Friend of Sinners. While rhetorically effective for 'ground clearing,' the entailments of the first half (avoid sinners) and the second half (embrace sinners) remain in unresolved tension.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher tells youth to flee 'riff-raff' but praises Jesus for 'hanging out' with them.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: If sin is a contagious plague, Jesus' proximity is suicidal; if Jesus is the model, the advice to 'flee' is un-Christlike.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Jesus is the Physician (Medical) whose medicine is Friendship (Relational).

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'Friend of Sinners' cliché and grounds it in the concrete social risks of gossip and slander.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The finger pointers wagged their heads... the venomed word ran on.

risicos.beschrijving: By focusing heavily on 'Friendship,' the holiness and transcendence of God may be diminished.
risicos.voorbeeld: He is a friend who all our sins does bear.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God as a peer rather than Lord.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A 1st-century dinner party filled with 'riff-raff' and whispering critics.
sub_worlds: A modern household with parents warning children
A courtroom where 'libel' is being discussed

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; connects social friendship to sacrificial love.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Using the language of 'standing in your stead' and 'enrolled by your name.'

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Contrasting Jesus with the asceticism of John the Baptist.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly fits a service focused on Grace or Communion.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Relational domain (Friendship), supported by Medical and Juridical sub-metaphors. It successfully moves from a 'Moralist' source domain to a 'Gospel' source domain, though the transition creates some cognitive dissonance regarding how the believer should treat 'bad company.'

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Describe the specific 'symptoms' of the 'riff-raff' to make the healing more concrete.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The fever of greed, the paralysis of shame.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The 'Bad Apple' vs. 'Friend of Sinners' tension.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Clarify that Jesus is the 'Anti-Rot'—he doesn't catch the decay; he infects the decay with life.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Friends are equals; God is not our equal.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'King' or 'Lord' domain to maintain verticality.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To show how Jesus builds a new 'house' for the outcasts.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The Church as a community of the 'broken'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful use of CMT to subvert moralism, though the introductory metaphors need tighter integration with the Christological conclusion.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the alliteration of 'libel/label'; CMT shows how this wordplay actually re-maps the hearer's understanding of Christ's social identity.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Kolb would focus on the 'Friend' as a relational role; CMT focuses on how the 'Friend' source domain dictates the logic of the Atonement (sacrifice for friends).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT reveals that the preacher uses 'Verticality' (looking up vs. talking down) to establish a moral hierarchy before Jesus 'levels' the field through proximity.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'common people' as a synonym for 'sinners,' which is a fascinating cultural-linguistic mapping of class onto morality.
